node.title: U.S. developing hypersonic missiles with U.K. and Australia
node.description: The move comes as China and Russia make rapid advances in their programs. Hypersonic missiles are so fast they can't be intercepted by any current missile defense system.

node.title: Pope Francis kisses a Ukrainian flag, denounces "massacre in Bucha"
node.description: The pope lamented "cruelty that is increasingly horrendous" in Russia's war on Ukraine and slammed the "impotence of international organizations" for failing to stop it.

node.title: Toddler shoots 4-year-old sister to death inside car at gas station
node.description: Last year, there were at least 379 unintentional shootings by children nationwide, resulting in 154 deaths, one group estimates.

node.title: Energy expert Mark Finely on global effects of Russia's war in Ukraine
node.description: Finley explains the effects of Russia's invasion of Ukraine on global oil and gas markets and discusses the risk of a recession.

node.title: GOP Senate push focuses on Latinos with "Vamos" initiative, Title 42
node.description: The NRSC's new multi-million-dollar "Vamos" initiative, first shared with CBS News, will target 2022 races in nine battleground states.

node.title: U.S. OK's up to $95 million to support Taiwan's Patriot missile system
node.description: The latest arms purchase comes as Taiwan closely watches the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, as it also lives under the constant threat of an invasion by a giant neighbor.

node.title: Netherlands seizes 14 yachts as Russia faces new sanctions over Ukraine
node.description: The Dutch government said the "vessels cannot be delivered, transferred or exported" while their ownership is investigated for links to the Kremlin.

node.title: Airbnb lashes out at Christchurch housing rule changes
node.description: Airbnb has called new home sharing regulations in Christchurch restrictive and outdated.

node.title: Not all heroes wear capes - some drive bulldozers
node.description: As heavy rain fell in northern Hawke's Bay two weeks ago, Hamish Pryde waded his bulldozer through deep water to reach the Wairoa River, where he worked till nightfall to stop a potential disaster.

node.title: Road User Charges bill passes, taking effect 21 April
node.description: A bill discounting road user charges by 36 percent has passed its third reading in Parliament.

node.title: Oklahoma passes near-total abortion ban with threat of jail for providers
node.description: Lawmakers have passed a bill that would make it illegal to perform an abortion in the state except in medical emergencies.

node.title: Franchisees allege 7-Eleven model based on wage theft
node.description: Convenience store giant 7-Eleven is set to pay out almost $A100m after being hit with class actions by Australian franchisees.

node.title: U.S. helps China seek clues on plane's deadly nosedive into a mountain
node.description: Both black boxes from the China Eastern Airlines 737 that crashed last month, killing all 132 on board, are with NTSB experts in Washington.

node.title: Covid-19: What is the new XE variant?
node.description: The Ministry of Health is heeding a WHO warning about wider surveillance needed to detect a new Covid-19 recombinant. Here's what we know. Audio

node.title: Covid-19: NSW doctors believe thousands of daily cases unreported
node.description: New South Wales public health physicians believe the state's daily Covid-19 figures are at least 50 percent higher than the reported number, due to unreported positive results.

node.title: Tauranga man fined $5250 for illegal plant imports
node.description: A Tauranga man has been sentenced in Auckland District Court today for trying to smuggle exotic plants "by stealth" after repeated warnings.

node.title: First shipment of NZ defence equipment arrives to aid Ukraine
node.description: Surplus defence equipment from New Zealand donated by the government has arrived in Europe to aid Ukraine in its war with Russia.

node.title: 2 wounded, suspect dead after shooting at South Carolina plant
node.description: Officials said the shooter was a former employee and died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

node.title: Highway boxes binned as Palmerston North changes cycle path plans
node.description: A main highway into Palmerston North will no longer be lined by unpopular brightly coloured planter boxes after city councillors on Wednesday voted for their removal.

node.title: FinTech sector experiencing exponential growth - report
node.description: The first detailed look at New Zealand's FinTech sector indicates it is growing faster than its global counterparts, with the 19 biggest firms generating $1.8 billion revenue last year.

node.title: Claim Rotorua council 'using ratepayer money to fight ratepayers'
node.description: A farmer is accusing the district council of "arrogance" for showing up to a Local Government Commission hearing with a ratepayer-funded lawyer.

node.title: Cost of fluoridating Christchurch's water blows out to $63m
node.description: Christchurch city councillors have been told it would cost $63 million and take at least three years to fluoridate the city's water supply.

node.title: Red zone land occupied by protesters: 'We're hoping we can get a quick resolution'
node.description: The Christchurch council is meeting daily with an anti-mandate group who are camping on earthquake-damaged land in the city, as it tries to determine if red zone land is considered a park.

node.title: Tiger to play Masters
node.description: Tiger Woods will play in this week's Masters and feels he can win the event for a sixth time in his highly-anticipated return to competition following a car crash last year.

node.title: UK, US, Australia agree to work on hypersonics under defence pact
node.description: Britain, the United States and Australia on Tuesday agreed to cooperate on hypersonic weapons and electronic warfare capabilities, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's office says.

node.title: Black Caps farewell Taylor with dominant win
node.description: The Black Caps have farewelled Ross Taylor from international cricket with a comprehensive 115 run win over the Netherlands, in the final one dayer in Hamilton.

node.title: Elon Musk to join Twitter board, promises change
node.description: Twitter says it will offer Tesla boss and entrepreneur Elon Musk a seat on its board of directors, after it was revealed he had amassed a 9.2 percent stake in the platform.

node.title: Global dairy price falls 1%
node.description: Global dairy prices have have fallen for a second consecutive auction, but remain near record levels.

node.title: Heavy winds ground helicopters in Invercargill blaze
node.description: Windy and unfavourable weather conditions have put efforts to fight a large fire south of Invercargill on hold.

node.title: Auckland Transport says it needs more money to keep operating
node.description: Auckland Transport says it's struggling to afford an essential level of public transport services, as it tries to lure people back to buses, trains and ferries.
